R-Bookdown with Python and SQL on Github Pages 1 Local installation Bookdown Reference Make it look nice 1.1 Intall R and its packages sudo apt install r-cran-bookdown 1.2 Install Python with a shared library CONFIGURE_OPTS=--enable-shared pyenv install 3.10.6 1.3 Install packages python -m venv venv source venv/bin/activate pip install -U pip pip install -r requirements.txt Rscript -e "library(reticulate); py_install('pandas==1.5.3')"

4 Python 4.1 Check Python version 4.2 Print using Python 4.3 Import pandas and print a DataFrame

4 Python 4.1 Check Python version python --version ## Python 3.10.6 4.2 Print using Python print("Hello World") ## Hello World 4.3 Import pandas and print a DataFrame import pandas as pd print(pd.__version__) ## 1.5.3 data = {'A': [1, 2, 3], 'B': [4, 5, 6]} # Create a pandas dataframe from the dictionary df = pd.DataFrame(data) # Print the dataframe print(df) ## A B ## 0 1 4 ## 1 2 5 ## 2 3 6

5 SQL library(DBI) db = dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), dbname = "db.sqlite") CREATE TABLE users AS SELECT 1 AS user_id, DATETIME("2023-01-01") AS created_at UNION ALL SELECT 2 AS user_id, DATETIME("2023-01-01") AS created_at UNION ALL SELECT 3 AS user_id, DATETIME("2023-01-01") AS created_at; CREATE TABLE trackers AS SELECT 1 AS user_id, 1 AS trackable_id, DATETIME("2023-01-04") AS created_at UNION ALL SELECT 2 AS user_id, 1 AS trackable_id, DATETIME("2023-01-02") AS created_at UNION ALL SELECT 2 AS user_id, 1 AS trackable_id, DATETIME("2023-01-02") AS created_at; SELECT * FROM users; SELECT * FROM trackers; Table 5.1: 3 records user_id created_at 1 2023-01-01 00:00:00 2 2023-01-01 00:00:00 3 2023-01-01 00:00:00
